metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17569 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: The refactoring present in Apache Tomcat 9.0.28 to 9.0.30, 8.5.48 to 8.5.50 and 7.0.98 to 7.0.99 introduced a regression. The result of the regression was that invalid Transfer-Encoding headers were incorrectly processed leading to a possibility of HTTP Request Smuggling if Tomcat was located behind a reverse proxy that incorrectly handled the invalid Transfer-Encoding header in a particular manner. Such a reverse proxy is considered unlikely.

criterions.comment: tomcat7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
